nodes.text: Unidentified shock trooper officer

A clone trooper officer served as a shock trooper in the Galactic Republic and subsequently the Galactic Empire. He was present on Kamino with a contingent of other shock troopers, and at one point returned to Kamino escorting Admiral Wilhuff Tarkin as he assessed the need of clone troopers.
Biography
Republic service

Grown on the planet Kamino from the DNA of Jango Fett, a bounty hunter who became the template of the clone trooper army, the clone served as a shock trooper in the Grand Army of the Republic. He was a clone trooper officer and was stationed on Kamino's Tipoca City Military Complex along with a large detachment of Coruscant Guard shock troopers in the direct aftermath of the execution of Order 66 and the start of the Great Jedi Purge. He was escorting a contingent of shock troopers through one of the hangars at Tipoca City when Clone Force 99 arrived in the Havoc Marauder.

There, the shock trooper officer informed Clone Force 99 that the Clone Wars was over, after witnessing squad member "Wrecker" asking his squadmates what they missed after hearing a security lockdown announcement. Clone Force 99 Clone Sergeant "Hunter" asked for clarification, which the officer provided by informing the unit that Confederacy of Independent Systems Supreme Martial Commander of the Separatist Droid Armies General Grievous was killed on Utapau and that the Separatist leadership had collapsed.

After this, two clone troopers were carrying the body of a deceased Jedi through the hangar on a stretcher, and the shock trooper officer picked up their lightsaber once it fell. They then asked Clone Force 99 if there was a problem to which Sergeant Hunter iterated that there were no issues, and that they would return to their barracks. The officer informed them that they must hurry, as a mandatory general assembly was called at 1500 hours. The assembly featured the Proclamation of the New Order by Supreme Chancellor Sheev Palpatine to the Galactic Senate of the Republic, as he established the Galactic Empire.
Imperial service

After some time, the clone shock trooper officer escorted Admiral Wilhuff Tarkin to Kamino aboard his Nu-class attack/transport shuttle alongside three other shock troopers. Tarkin sought to assess the needs and costs of the Imperial Army. Following a scuffle in the cafeteria between Clone Force 99 and other clone troopers, Clone Force 99 was summoned by Admiral Tarkin. Assuming that they were being reprimanded, they passed the shock trooper officer and two other shock troopers in a corridor. The officer turned and informed them to head to the Tipoca City Training Facility as Tarkin sought to view their performance.

While Clone Force 99 was returning from a mission to Onderon, the officer arrived at the barracks of the unit with several standard Imperial clone troopers to remove the squad's gear to the hangar. While opening the door, the officer bumped into the enhanced young clone Omega and AZI-3. The officer informed Omega that she was not authorized to be there, and ordered the other clones to pack up the squad's gear. Afterward, the officer stated that Omega was going to go with him and grabbed her, but AZI intervened by grabbing the officer's arm and stated that as medical personnel, they would not follow the officer. The shock trooper officer then told the droid not to touch him, and stunned AZI, shutting it down. The officer then grabbed Omega and proceeded to move her.

Shortly after Clone Force 99 landed in a hangar, a contingent of shock troopers stealthily surrounded the unit by using the crates and storage in the area. Once the shock troopers surrounded the squad, the shock trooper officer moved in alongside Admiral Tarkin. Clone Force 99 was subsequently imprisoned in a holding area, but eventually managed to escape with Omega despite one member, CT-9904, remaining loyal to the Empire and leading a group of other shock troopers in a skirmish at the hangar.
Personality and traits

As a clone of the bounty hunter Jango Fett, the shock trooper officer was a human male who stood at 1.83 meters tall. He disliked being touched by droids and did not hesitate to fire on AZI-3 when the medical droid attempted to stop him from arresting Omega. As an officer of the Galactic Empire, the clone had no regard for the property of the Kaminoan government, having damaged one of their droids while arresting Nala Se's medical assistant.
Skills and abilities
The clone was an officer, and as such had administrative duties on Kamino. He also possessed leadership capabilities.
Equipment

The clone shock trooper officer was equipped with Phase II clone trooper armor during his active service, which donned the red markings of the Coruscant Guard, albeit a brighter red. When the officer escorted Admiral Tarkin, he was equipped with a DC-15A blaster carbine. As an officer, he made use of a red left-shoulder pauldron, and often used a datapad. Later in his Imperial service, the officer equipped himself with a holder on his right thigh for a DC-17 hand blaster. The officer's Phase II helmet was slightly damaged near the mouth area.
Behind the scenes
The shock trooper officer appeared, albeit unnamed, in the premier episode for Star Wars: The Bad Batch, titled "Aftermath." The episode aired in 2021, and the clone was voiced by Dee Bradley Baker.
